channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Newsmax to pay $67 million to settle defamation case linked to 2020 election
item.description: Newsmax will pay Denver-based Dominion Voting Systems $67 million to settle a defamation claim over false statements Newsmax aired about the 2020 election.

item.title: What are the prospects for a peace deal between Russia and Ukraine?
item.description: NPR talks with Evelyn Farkas, a former Pentagon official who's now executive director of the McCain Institute at Arizona State University, about prospects for a peace deal between Russia and Ukraine.

item.title: A look at possible next steps in brokering a peace deal between Russia and Ukraine
item.description: What's next for President Trump's push to broker an end to Russia's war on Ukraine after extraordinary meetings with Zelenskyy and European leaders at the White House on Monday?

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump plans next steps to broker an end to Russia's war on Ukraine, a look at Moscow's view of the peace talks, California lawmakers seek to overhaul the state's congressional map to counter Texas.

item.title: India reels from Trump administration tariff threats
item.description: India is reeling after the Trump administration threatened it with some of the highest tariffs in the world in order to pressure it to change course with Russia.

item.title: Cambridge Dictionary adds more than 6,000 words, including skibidi and delulu
item.description: Internet culture has infiltrated the English language. New additions to the Cambridge Dictionary this year include skibidi, delulu, tradwife and broligarchy.

item.title: Baltimore Mayor Brandon Scott discusses how the city has brought violent crime down
item.description: Baltimore Mayor Brandon Scott speaks with NPR's Michel Martin about how the city has been working to reduce violent crime, now at historic lows, according to city data.

item.title: White House says dozens of homeless encampments cleared from Washington, D.C.
item.description: Despite objections from homeless advocates, the White House says more than 40 homeless encampments have been removed in D.C. since President Trump announced a federal law enforcement surge.

item.title: A look at arguments around Colorado's medical assistance in dying law
item.description: As more states adopt laws allowing terminally ill patients to end their own lives, some groups representing disabled people are suing to stop them.

item.title: Dover Quartet teams up with Chickasaw composer on album 'Woodland Songs'
item.description: NPR speaks with cellist Camden Shaw and Chickasaw composer Jerod Impichchaachaaha' Tate about the Dover Quartet's album "Woodland Songs," featuring a commissioned suite of character studies of animals.
